result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsey Michelle Clayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lindsey Michelle Clayton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lindsey Michelle Clayton was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsey Michelle Clayton

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lindsey Michelle Clayton
Current: 615 Stokke Pkwy, C/O Dunn County Jail, Menomonie, WI 54751 United States  (Effective: 06-08-2015)
Prior: 217 Sunset Street  #201, Longmont, CO 80501 United States

2:32 Defendant Lindsey Michelle Clayton in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Lindsey Michelle Clayton in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan:  guilty to Ct#2 of the information. Dismiss Ct#1. Time served been in custody about 6 weeks. Larimore and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2 in the information; Larimore stipulates to a factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#2 contained in the information. Dismiss Ct#1. OSullivan and Larimore address sentencing.  Court sentences Def to time served.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

phone:  720-346-3057
address:  217 Sunset St  Apt 201, Longmont, CO 80501

3:30  PM  
Defendant Lindsey Michelle Clayton in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Liesl Nelson in the courtroom.  Defendant Lindsey Michelle Clayton in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nelson responds.  Def lives in Colorado.  Joel Larimore was her attorney.  Thorie: def missed pretrial.  Her address was in Maryland; now she lives in Colorado.  She was brought here by Lock and Load from the State of Colorado.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 11:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lindsey Michelle Clayton
Current: 217 Sunset Street  #201, Longmont, CO 80501 United States  (Effective: 04-23-2015)
Prior: 11712 Willhide Road, Thurmont, MD 21788
Pre-trial conference on February 3, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Def pleas not guilty. Court receives and enters not guilty pleas. Bond will continue in it's present form. Larimore requests Def appear via phone for pretrial. OSullivan has no objection. Court: Def to call into the court.

11:59 Defendant Lindsey Michelle Clayton in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Osullivan withdraws his request for a warrant. Court withdraws warrant.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def gives up her right to have a preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waivers. Finds probable cause the Def has committed the crime alleged. OSullivan files the informtion.Def has a copy and waives reading of information.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

10:03  am  
Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NO APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT.  States asks for bench warrant - body only.  Officer Rhiel appears today, but State asks that he may be allowed to appear telephonically.  Atty Larimore presumes it may be a waiver when she appears.  Court will allow Officer Rhiel to appear by phone unless there are exhibits he must testify to, and he may appear by phone if the def does not object.
Preliminary hearing on January 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Def voluntarily waives her 20 days time limit for PH.
